data.title: Inside YouTube, leaders look for ‘balance’ after scandals
data.text: Neal Mohan, second in command at the video site, handles an evolving role.

data.title: YouTube is giving creators more ways to make money
data.text: YouTube is rolling out more ways for its creators to engage fans and generate revenue, the company announced today the VidCon event in Anaheim, California. Last year, YouTube used the event to launch new products like channel memberships, merchandise shelves, premieres, and more.

data.title: US tech companies face new French tax – four experts weigh in
data.text: France's Senate on Thursday approved a tax on revenues from major tech companies, including Google, Amazon and Facebook, raising the ire of the White House. Here's what the impact could be.

data.title: France approves digital tax targeting US tech companies
data.text: FoxNew.com columnist Liz Peek, Kaltbaum Capital Management President Gary Kaltbaum, FOX Business’ Kristina Partsinevelos and Capitalist Pig Hedge Fund’s Jonathan Hoenig on France’s new digital tax.

data.title: France to tax big tech despite US trade threat: RPT
data.text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Sozzi reports on France rolling out a  digital services tax on big tech companies such as Facebook and Google which may result in a retaliatory  tax from the United States.

data.title: Google workers can listen to what people say to its AI home devices
data.text: Company admitted that contractors can access recordings made by Assistant, after some of its recordings were leaked

data.title: How Much Is Your Data Worth to Tech Companies? Lawmakers Want to Tell You, But It’s Not That Easy to Calculate
data.text: A proposed bill would force tech companies to tell users how much their data is worth. But how can a single number capture data's power to predict your actions or sway your decisions?

data.title: New Google Area 120 project Shoelace aims to connect people around shared interests
data.text: A new project from Google’s in-house incubator, Area 120, aims to help people find things to do and others who share your same interests. Through a new app called Shoelace — a name designed to make you think of tying things together — users can browse through a set of hand-picked activities, or add their […]

data.title: Shoelace App: 11 Things to Know About Google’s New Social Network
data.text:
The Shoelace app is Google's next attempt at creating a social network, but this time the company wants it to be a more local experience.
The post Shoelace App: 11 Things to Know About Google’s New Social Network appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Google is investigating the source of voice data leak, plans to update its privacy policies
data.text: Google has responded to a report this week from Belgian public broadcaster VRT NWS, which revealed that contractors were given access to Google Assistant voice recordings, including those which contained sensitive information — like addresses, conversations between parents and children, business calls, and others containing all sorts of private information. As a result of the […]

data.title: Google admits partners leaked more than 1,000 private conversations with Google Assistant
data.text: Google on Wednesday admitted that partners who work to analyze voice snippets collected when people talk to the Google Assistant were leaked to a Belgian press outlet.

data.title: US to probe France's plan to tax tech giants like Google and Apple
data.text: CNBC Technology Correspondent Elizabeth Schulze runs through the latest tech news.

data.title: Google's plans for a mega-campus in San Jose lurk behind its recent $1 billion housing pledge
data.text: For more than a year, local residents have expressed concern about rising rents and displacement as Google's plans for a massive expansion in San Jose continue.

data.title: Google Cloud adds its first North American sales head as it tries to catch up to Microsoft, Amazon
data.text: Google Cloud is bolstering its sales executive team as it plans rapid growth.

data.title: The Success of the New Pixel Is One More Reason to Buy Google Stock
data.text: In the past couple weeks FAANG stocks has re-awoken.

data.title: Google as a landlord? A looming feudal nightmare | Veena Dubal
data.text: To fight a housing crunch of their own creation, tech companies are planning company towns worthy of Gilded Age robber barons
